bugs.title: CVE-2023-22298 pgadmin4: Open URL Redirect Vulnerability [fedora-36]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-22298 pgadmin4: Open URL Redirect Vulnerability [fedora-36]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-22298 pgadmin4: Open URL Redirect Vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
Open redirect vulnerability in pgAdmin 4 versions prior to v6.14 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect a user to an arbitrary web site and conduct a phishing attack by having a user to access a specially crafted URL.

https://github.com/pgadmin-org/pgadmin4
https://github.com/pgadmin-org/pgadmin4/issues/5343
https://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN03832974/index.html
https://www.pgadmin.org/

Created pgadmin4 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2161638]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2161637

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2161637,2161638

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

FEDORA-2023-a17a67683d has been pushed to the Fedora 36 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-a17a67683d`

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2023-0334c6000a has been pushed to the Fedora 36 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

pgAdmin 4 versions prior to v6.19 contains a directory traversal vulnerability. A user of the product may change another user's settings or alter the database.

References:
https://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN01398015/
https://github.com/pgadmin-org/pgadmin4/issues/5734

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by smani.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has obsoleted [pgadmin4-6.12-7.fc36](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-a17a67683d), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.
